dataIdInfo.idAbs: Execute a Oozie workflow using Oozie webservices API.

tool.name: ExecuteWorkflow

param.name: in_jobprops_file
param.dialogReference:
Specify the Job Properties file to execute Oozie workflow. The job properties file must atleast have the following information to run a workflow job :

nameNode=hdfs://mymachine.esri.com:8020

jobTracker=mymachine.esri.com:8021

user.name=hdfs

oozie.wf.application.path=hdfs://mymachine.esri.com:8020/user/oozie-temp/job

oozie.libpath=hdfs://mymachine.esri.com:8020/user/oozie-temp/lib

For more information : http://oozie.apache.org/docs/3.3.0/WebServicesAPI.htm
param.pythonReference: Specify the Job Properties file to execute Oozie workflow.

param.name: track_status
param.dialogReference:
Tracks the status of the submitted workflow.

  • Checked: Monitors and reports the status of the submitted workflow until it succeeds or fails.

  • Unchecked: Submits the workflow and starts it but the tool will not monitor the status. However, the tool will specify the jobid of the submitted workflow job.
param.pythonReference:
Tracks the status of the submitted workflow.

  • Checked: Monitors and reports the status of the submitted workflow until it succeeds or fails.

  • Unchecked: Submits the workflow and starts it but the tool will not monitor the status. However, The tool will specify the jobid of the submitted workflow job.

tool.summary: Execute a Oozie workflow using Oozie webservices API.
